title: Edge on Demand: Halloween, Edward Snowden & Selfies
text:
Story Created: Sep 29, 2015 at 11:29 PM EDT Story Updated: Sep 29, 2015 at 11:29 PM EDT 
Halloween is just about a month away, and one mom is not happy about the selection of costumes available for her three-year-old daughter. Lin Kramer posted an open letter to Party City's Facebook page earlier this month. In it, she urged the store to stop selling "sexualized" Halloween costumes for young girls. 
Kramer states Party City offers a wide rage of career costumes for boys, including one of a police officer. When it comes to girls, only three career costumes are available: a cheerleader, a cowgirl and, again, a police officer... but this one has a completely different look. 
Kramer requested the company at least offer girls more options, saying: " Even if you insist (and i really hope you don't) on offering the sexualized version of costumes for little girls, you could *also* offer girls the realistic option of the same costume." 
Party City responded to Kramer's message, thanking her for feedback, but then deleted her initial post on their Facebook page. Still, it's gaining national attention, with people on both sides of the argument commenting on the issue. 
So what do you think? Have Halloween costumes for little girls become too sexy?
